abstract: What is the easier way to run the Windows operating system on Intel-based Macintosh hardware — Boot Camp or a program like Parallels?
snippet: What is the easier way to run the Windows operating system on Intel-based Macintosh hardware — Boot Camp or a program like Parallels?
lead_paragraph: Q. What is the easier way to run the Windows operating system on Intel-based Macintosh hardware  Boot Camp or a program like Parallels?

headline.main: How to Juggle Windows on Mac

abstract: (6:45 P.M. UPDATE: Research in Motion apparently thinks Apple is on to a good thing. The company plans to introduce a BlackBerry with a touch-screen keyboard in the third quarter, according to the blog Boy Genius Report.)
lead_paragraph: (6:45 P.M. UPDATE: Research in Motion apparently thinks Apple is on to a good thing. The company plans to introduce a BlackBerry with a touch-screen keyboard in the third quarter, according to the blog Boy Genius Report.)

headline.main: Dreaming of an iPhone Keyboard as Good as a BlackBerry’s
